intro: Echeandia aequatoris, commonly known as the Ecuadorian echeandia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often woody at the base. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
